To all of you little monsters that have issues with the incorrect ASPECT RATIO (myself included), I was able to correct it with relative ease using HandBrake for OS X.

The original (incorrect AR) picture size is 680x360.  Change this to 680x280 and it's almost perfect.  You need to be able to change the ratio arbitrarily, as it's not a "proper" ratio.

I'm pretty sure I added an extra step in letting HandBrake output the file as an H264 MP4 file, as I need to run that through FFmpegX to end up with a DivX AVI that my Xbox360 can play.
